xTtyeA.sha512
SHA512
Description:
SHA-512 is a cryptographic hash function that takes an input and produces a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value. 

It is part of the SHA-2 family of hash functions, which also includes SHA-224, SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512/224, and SHA-512/256. SHA-512 is designed to be more secure than its predecessor, SHA-1, which has been shown to be vulnerable to collision attacks. 

SHA-512 is widely used in digital signatures, message authentication codes, and other applications where data integrity is critical.
